column4: I have an EC2 server running on AWS, small instance ubuntu 10.04 TLS (lucid).

I installed Apache Web server, initially on port 80. When trying to remotely access the server through a web browser it went well. After that I changed the apache server port to 8040, and I opened the port in the AWS security groups.. trying to connect it also succeeded.

Now, after those two trials, I tried to run sort of a web service also on port 8040 (after closing the apache server of course). The web service is the web ui of the heritrix crawler. Now, when trying to connect to the service localy (i tried "telnet localhost 8040") I am able to connect to the service. Now when I try to remotely connect I am failing no matter what I do.. I try to remotely...
...connect from a web browser by doing: http://my.amazon.address:8040

I really tried almost every thing, I tried to add exceptions to the iptables, even cancel the iptables all together. I opened the ports for all IPs in the AWS dashboard.. but still nothing. And again just to emphasize, local connection go well, also remote connections to apache web server went well to the same port... What the hell am I missing?!
Is the 8040 connection connecting directly to the heritrix crawler? or is it through apache?
Sounds like the heritrix/jetix server is binding itself to a local address
isn't it bind itself to a port?
is it possible to bind yourself to an address?
It picks a port, but many programs also allow you to pick an IP (or range) that it'll talk to.  People use it to make MySQL only talk to localhost, etc.
